page.title: 09ST. JOHN'S CHURCH TEMPLETON.
page.content: St. John's Church was built in 1859 on the site of a hospice of the Knights Templar.There are about 50 members and there should be 2 wardens but there is only 1 at the moment.There is seating for 225 people.The bell was installed in 1859. Mr. Hubert Davies is the bell ringer.The oldest gravestone is 120 years old.The visible donations are Vicar's stall,Communion plate,Altar Book,carpet,vases and kneelers.The sister Church is St.Eldyr in Ludchurch.There are special services at Easter,Whitsuntide,Harvest,Mother's Day,Confirmation and a Carol Singing Festival.Christenings,weddings and funeral services are held too. Rev.T.Hugh Thomas,Rural Dean of Narberth,is the Acting Priest In Charge owing to the retirement of Rev.J.B.Lewis.
